de.mrapp.android.util.view

Class ViewRecycler<ItemType,ParamType>

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.mrapp.android.util.view.AbstractViewRecycler<ItemType,ParamType>
      • de.mrapp.android.util.view.ViewRecycler<ItemType,ParamType>
  • Type Parameters:
    ItemType - The type of the items, which should be visualized by inflated views
    ParamType - The type of the optional parameters, which may be passed when inflating a view

    public class ViewRecycler<ItemType,ParamType>
extends AbstractViewRecycler<ItemType,ParamType>
    A recycler, which allows to cache views in order to be able to reuse them later, instead of inflating new instances.
    Since:
    1.15.0
    Author:
    Michael Rapp

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class de.mrapp.android.util.view.AbstractViewRecycler

        AbstractViewRecycler.Adapter<ItemType,ParamType>

      ViewRecycler(android.view.LayoutInflater inflater)
      Creates a new recycler, which allows to cache views in order to be able to reuse them later, instead of inflating new instances.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ViewRecycler

        public ViewRecycler(@NonNull
                    android.content.Context context)
        Creates a new recycler, which allows to cache views in order to be able to reuse them later, instead of inflating new instances.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the recycler, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null

      • ViewRecycler

        public ViewRecycler(@NonNull
                    android.view.LayoutInflater inflater)
        Creates a new recycler, which allows to cache views in order to be able to reuse them later, instead of inflating new instances.
        Parameters:
        inflater - The layout inflater, which should be used to inflate views, as an instance of the class LayoutInflater. The layout inflater may not be null

    • Method Detail

      • inflate

        @SafeVarargs
 @NonNull
public final android.support.v4.util.Pair<android.view.View,java.lang.Boolean> inflate(@NonNull
                                                                                                              ItemType item,
                                                                                                              @Nullable
                                                                                                              android.view.ViewGroup parent,
                                                                                                              @NonNull
                                                                                                              ParamType... params)
        Inflates the view, which is used to visualize a specific item. If possible, an unused view will be retrieved from the cache, instead of inflating a new instance.
        Parameters:
        item - The item, which should be visualized by the inflated view, as an instance of the generic type ItemType. The item may not be null
        parent - The parent of the inflated view as an instance of the class ViewGroup or null, if no parent is available
        params - An array, which may contain optional parameters, as an array of the generic type ParamType or an empty array, if no optional parameters are available
        Returns:
        A pair, which contains the view, which is used to visualize the given item, as well as a boolean value, which indicates, whether a new view has been inflated, or if an unused view has been reused from the cache, as an instance of the class Pair. The pair may not be null

      • inflate

        @SafeVarargs
 @NonNull
public final android.support.v4.util.Pair<android.view.View,java.lang.Boolean> inflate(@NonNull
                                                                                                              ItemType item,
                                                                                                              @Nullable
                                                                                                              android.view.ViewGroup parent,
                                                                                                              boolean useCache,
                                                                                                              @NonNull
                                                                                                              ParamType... params)
        Inflates the view, which is used to visualize a specific item.
        Parameters:
        item - The item, which should be visualized by the inflated view, as an instance of the generic type ItemType. The item may not be null
        parent - The parent of the inflated view as an instance of the class ViewGroup or null, if no parent is available
        useCache - True, if an unused view should retrieved from the cache, if possible, false, if a new instance should be inflated instead
        params - An array, which may contain optional parameters, as an array of the generic type ParamType or an empty array, if no optional parameters are available
        Returns:
        A pair, which contains the view, which is used to visualize the given item, as well as a boolean value, which indicates, whether a new view has been inflated, or if an unused view has been reused from the cache, as an instance of the class Pair. The pair may not be null

      • remove

        public final void remove(@NonNull
                         ItemType item)
        Description copied from class: AbstractViewRecycler
        Removes a previously inflated view, which is used to visualize a specific item. If caching is enabled, the view will be put into a cache in order to be able to reuse it later.
        Specified by:
        remove in class AbstractViewRecycler<ItemType,ParamType>
        Parameters:
        item - The item, which is visualized by the view, which should be removed, as an instance of the generic type ItemType. The item may not be null

      • removeAll

        public final void removeAll()
        Description copied from class: AbstractViewRecycler
        Removes all previously inflated views. If caching is enabled, all of these views will be added to a cache in order to be able to reuse them later.
        Specified by:
        removeAll in class AbstractViewRecycler<ItemType,ParamType>
